Container.Name: openldap-tiredofit
Container.Overview:
a OpenLDAP server for maintaining a directory. Upon starting this image it will give you a ready to run server with many configurable options.
Tracks latest release
Compiles from source
Multiple backends (bdb, hdb, mdb, sql)
All overlays compiled
Supports TLS encryption
Supports Replication
Optional Web Server included to take advantage of Let's Encrypt certificates
Scheduled Backups of Data
Ability to choose NIS or rfc2307bis Schema
Two Password Checking Modules - check_password.so and ppm.so
Zabbix Monitoring templates included
This Container uses a customized Alpine Linux base which includes s6 overlay enabled for PID 1 Init capabilities, zabbix-agent for individual container monitoring, Cron also installed along with other tools (bash,curl, less, logrotate, mariadb-client, nano, vim) for easier management. It also supports sending to external SMTP servers..

Config.Name: Unecrypted LDAP
Config.Description: Unecrypted LDAP

Config.Name: Data Directory
Config.Description: /var/lib/openldap - Data Directory

Config.Name: Configuration Directory
Config.Description: /etc/openldap/slapd.d - Configuration Directory

Config.Name: Backup Directory
Config.Description: /data/backup - Backup Directory

Config.Name: DOMAIN
Config.Description: LDAP domain

Config.Name: BASE_DN
Config.Description: LDAP base DN. If empty automatically set from DOMAIN value.

Config.Name: ADMIN_PASS
Config.Description: Ldap Admin password

Config.Name: CONFIG_PASS
Config.Description: Ldap Config password

Config.Name: ORGANIZATION
Config.Description: Organization Name

Config.Name: ENABLE_READONLY_USER
Config.Description: Add a read only user Default: false

Config.Name: READONLY_USER_USER
Config.Description: Read only user username Default: readonly

Config.Name: READONLY_USER_PASS
Config.Description: Read only user password Default: readonly

Config.Name: SCHEMA_TYPE
Config.Description: Use nis or rfc2307bis core schema Default: nis

Config.Name: BACKEND
Config.Description: Ldap backend. bdb hdb mdb and others. Default: mdb

Config.Name: LOG_LEVEL
Config.Description: Set LDAP Log Level Default: 256

Config.Name: ULIMIT_N
Config.Description: Set Open File Descriptor Limit Default: 1024

Config.Name: ENABLE_TLS
Config.Description: Add TLS capabilities. Can't be removed once set to true. Default: true

Config.Name: TLS_CA_CRT_PATH
Config.Description: TLS CA certificate path. Default /assets/slapd/certs

Config.Name: TLS_CA_CRT_FILENAME
Config.Description: TLS CA certificate filename. Default ca.pem

Config.Name: TLS_CRT_PATH
Config.Description: TLS certificate path. Default /assets/slapd/certs

Config.Name: TLS_CRT_FILENAME
Config.Description: TLS certificate filename. Default cert.pem

Config.Name: TLS_KEY_PATH
Config.Description: TLS certificate private key path. Default /assets/slapd/certs

Config.Name: TLS_KEY_FILENAME
Config.Description: TLS certificate private key filename. Default key.pem

Config.Name: TLS_DH_PARAM_PATH
Config.Description: TLS DHParam path. Default /assets/slapd/certs

Config.Name: TLS_DH_PARAM_FILENAME
Config.Description: TLS DHParam Filename. Default dhparam.pem

Config.Name: TLS_DH_PARAM_KEYSIZE
Config.Description: TLS DHParam Keysize. Default 2048

Config.Name: TLS_ENFORCE
Config.Description: Enforce TLS. Can't be disabled once set to true. Defaults false

Config.Name: TLS_RESET_PERMISSIONS
Config.Description: Change ownership and reset permissions on Certificates on startup. Default TRUE

Config.Name: TLS_CIPHER_SUITE
Config.Description: TLS cipher suite. Default ECDH+AESGCM:DH+AESGCM:ECDH+AES256:DH+AES256:ECDH+AES128:DH+AES:RSA+AESGCM:RSA+AES:-DHE-DSS:-RSA:!aNULL:!MD5:!DSS:!SHA

Config.Name: TLS_VERIFY_CLIENT
Config.Description: TLS verify client. Default try

Config.Name: BACKUP_CONFIG_CRON_PERIOD
Config.Description: Cron expression to schedule OpenLDAP config backup. Defaults 0 4 * * * Every day at 4am.

Config.Name: BACKUP_DATA_CRON_PERIOD
Config.Description: Cron expression to schedule OpenLDAP data backup. Defaults 0 4 * * * Every day at 4am.

Config.Name: BACKUP_TTL
Config.Description: Automatically cleanup backup after how many days. Default 15

Config.Name: ENABLE_NGINX
Config.Description: If you want to use automatic LetsEncrypt certificates for your server, set this to true Default: false

Config.Name: LetsEncrypt
Config.Description: Nginx - For Automatic LetsEncrypt Certficates

Config.Name: Landing page
Config.Description: /www/html - If you want to put a landing page if using Nginx for LetsEncrypt SSL Place it here

Config.Name: Custom Scripts
Config.Description: /assets/custom-scripts/ - If you'd like to execute a script during the initialization process drop it here
